3rd-Order Power

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a Humanoid they can see within 60 feet of them with a pulse of transformational energy. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or undergo one of the following transformations of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice:

Head. The target's head transforms into the head of a fish, proportionately sized for their body. They can't speak.

Legs. The target's legs become fins. Their walking speed is reduced to 10 feet (unless their walking speed is slower), and they gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

Torso. The target's torso becomes the body of a fish with gills. They can only breathe water and can hold their breath for 1 hour. If the target isn't underwater when this transformation takes effect, they begin suffocating.

This transformation lasts until the target is affected by a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher or a greater restoration spell. A target who suffers all three transformations at once is permanently transformed into a hybrid fishlike creature and can only be returned to their original form by a wish spell or similar magic.

Radiant Aversion.name: Radiant Aversion
Radiant Aversion.description: Each time the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes radiant damage, they take an extra 10 radiant damage.

Resting Place.name: Resting Place
Resting Place.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 0 hit points and is not in sunlight, running water, or their resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to their resting place. While in their resting place, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is stable. After spending 1 hour in their resting place with 0 hit points, they regain 1hit point.

Turn Resistance.name: Turn Resistance
Turn Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item 8fYbHoUo1cEvbVDs]] attacks and, if possible, a [[/item b1hbVDYui2BnmdtY]] attack.

Exsanguinating Mist.name: Exsanguinating Mist
Exsanguinating Mist.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]], along with anything they are wearing or carrying, turns into a cloud of blood-sucking mist. When they do, they release any creature they were grappling, and if the vampire was grappled or restrained, that effect ends for them. Then the [[lookup @name lowercase]] flies up to twice their speed to an unoccupied space. During this move, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores difficult terrain, doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and can move through creatures and objects. Each creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] passes through must make a [[/save]] saving throw, taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. At the end of this movement, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] transforms back into their previous form.

Run, My Child.name: Run, My Child
Run, My Child.description: When an ally the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see takes damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can command the ally to move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

utility.condition: When an ally the monster can see takes damage.

Inhuman Agility.name: Inhuman Agility
Inhuman Agility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Beguile.name: Beguile
Beguile.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one creature they can see within 30 feet of them and who can see them. The target must make a [[/save]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target uses their reaction, if available, to move up to their speed to a location chosen by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], then either makes a melee attack against a target of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice or falls &reference[prone] ([[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice).

Creatures who can't be charmed automatically succeed on this saving throw, and creatures who have advantage on saving throws against being charmed make this saving throw with advantage.

Utility Spells.name: Utility Spells
Utility Spells.description:
In addition to any other spells in this stat block, the vampire can cast the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

At will: charm person, detect thoughts, disguise self, sending

1/day each: clairvoyance, geas

Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Detached Eyes.name: Detached Eyes
Detached Eyes.description: Six eyes float around the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and create their Eye Psionics effects. Each eye is an object that has AC 24, 1 hit point, and a psionic shield that makes it immune to damage. After an eye creates a psionic effect, it loses its psionic shield until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. If an eye is destroyed, a new eye pops out of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s face to replace it at the end of their next turn.

Eye Psionics.name: Eye Psionics
Eye Psionics.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] creates three of the following psionic eye effects. Unless otherwise stated, each eye targets a creature who the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 120 feet of them. They can't use the same effect twice in a turn.

1. Charm Beam. The targeted creature must succeed on a [[/save activity=WnVEssfvwITbSuPh]] saving throw or be &reference[charmed] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour, or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] harms the creature or one of their allies.

2. Compulsion Beam. The targeted creature must succeed on a [[/save activity=alAhWz9wys5OfqzI]] saving throw or use their reaction, if available, to move up to their speed toward the closest ally they can see and make a weapon attack against them. Creatures who can't be charmed are unaffected.

3. Toxic Vapors. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses a point they can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature within 10 feet of the point must succeed on a [[/save activity=0Damu7ownejQs390]] saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

4. Telekinetic Beam. The targeted creature must succeed on a [[/save activity=0Lj5ynoTzbcL9kYH]] saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet in any direction and take [[/damage activity=0Lj5ynoTzbcL9kYH average]] damage at the end of the move. Alternatively, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can target an object they can see within 120 feet of them that weighs 300 pounds or less and isn't being worn or carried, moving it up to 30 feet in any direction. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can also exert fine control on objects with this effect, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

5. Lightning Bolt. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shoots a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line of lightning. Each creature in the line must succeed on a [[/save activity=gi324pZrFtdY8vX7]] saving throw, taking [[/damage average activity=gi324pZrFtdY8vX7]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

6. Fire Beam. The targeted creature must make a [[/save activity=C3vfOLSQ4gmVtu6b]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage average activity=C3vfOLSQ4gmVtu6b]] damage and catches fire, taking [[/damage 2d8 average fire]] damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). Any creature can use their action to douse the fire, ending the effect early.

Psionic Fire.name: Psionic Fire

You are on fire, and take [[/damage 2d8 fire average]] damage at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute. You can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

A creature can use an action to douse the fire, ending the effect on a success.

Eye Psionics.name: Eye Psionics
Eye Psionics.description:
[[lookup @name]] creates three of the following psionic eye effects. Unless otherwise stated, each eye targets a creature who they can see within 120 feet of themself. They can't use the same effect twice on a turn.

1. Charm Beam. The targeted creature must succeed on a [[/save activity=6ydejzjQOm3wE3U2]] saving throw or be &reference[charmed] by [[lookup @name]] for 1 hour, or until the monster harms the creature or one of their allies.

2. Compulsion Beam. The targeted creature must succeed on a [[/save activity=oxS8EOXi6PPNWK08]] saving throw or use their reaction, if available, to move up to their speed toward the closest ally they can see and make one weapon attack against them. Creatures who can't be charmed are unaffected.

3. Memory Beam. The targeted creature must make a [[/save activity=anFRk89bUNzICT1r]] saving throw. On a failed save, if the creature has unexpended spell slots, they expend a spell slot of their highest remaining level, with no effect. If they don't have unexpended spell slots, they instead lose proficiency with a weapon they're holding or carrying for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

4. Toxic Vapors. [[lookup @name]] chooses a point he can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature within 10 feet of the point must succeed on a [[/save activity=GPx3UQvMSWanYfvO]] saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

5. Telekinetic Field. [[lookup @name]] chooses a point they can see within 120 feet of them. Each enemy within 10 feet of the point must succeed on a [[/save activity=LZfq13jfZP6disrM]] saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet in any direction and take [[/damage average activity=LZfq13jfZP6disrM]] damage at the end of the move. Additionally, [[lookup @name]] can target any object within 10 feet of the point that weighs 300 pounds or less and isn't being worn or carried, moving it up to 30 feet in any direction. [[lookup @name]] can also exert fine control on objects with this effect, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

6. Lightning Bolt. [[lookup @name]] shoots a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line of lightning. Each creature in the line must succeed on a [[/save activity=oN3qmYgJRHBgsSLj]] saving throw, taking [[/damage average activity=oN3qmYgJRHBgsSLj]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

7. Explosion. [[lookup @name]] chooses a point they can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature within 10 feet of the point must make a [[/save activity=4pflL7rhtzWX7Ioi]] saving throw, taking [[/damage average activity=4pflL7rhtzWX7Ioi]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

8. Necrosis Beam. The targeted creature must succeed on a [[/save activity=ZliwHXX8N1bSmkke]] saving throw or immediately take [[/damage average activity=ZliwHXX8N1bSmkke]] damage and lose [[/damage 2d6 average]] hit points at the start of each of their turns. If this effect reduces a target's hit points to 0, they die. The effect ends if [[lookup @name]] dies or can't see the target. This psionic effect can't be used again while this effect persists.

[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Until the end of the target's next turn, they have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple, and they have advantage on ability checks made to initiate or maintain a grapple.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] polymorphs into a Tiny object or back into their true amorphous form. If four [[lookup @name lowercase]]s within 5 feet of each other use this action together, they can join together to become one Small object. Anything a [[lookup @name lowercase]] is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. A [[lookup @name lowercase]] in object form reverts to their true form if any [[lookup @name lowercase]] in the group moves, takes an action, or dies.

Ferocity.name: Ferocity
Ferocity.description:
Companions are dangerous creatures. Though often more docile than their wild counterparts, they aren't fully domesticated. Each companion's ferocity is a measure of their tenacity and fury, and of how those things build in battle. As a companion's ferocity increases, they gain access to powerful new actions, but they also become more difficult for a caregiver to control.

If a companion isn't incapacitated at the start of their and their caregiver's turn, their ferocity increases by 1d4 + the number of enemies the companion can see or hear within 5 feet of them. For the purpose of increasing ferocity, a group of creatures who share a single stat block (such as a swarm of rats) counts as one creature. Ferocity increases round after round during combat, and there is no maximum to the level of ferocity a companion can gain.

Rampage

After rolling to increase ferocity at the start of their turn, if a companion has 10 ferocity or more and isn't incapacitated, they run the risk of entering a rampage. The companion's caregiver can make a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check (no action required) to try to stop the companion from entering a rampage. To make the check, the caregiver must not be incapacitated, and the companion must be able to see or hear the caregiver. The DC for the check equals 5 + the companion's ferocity. On a success, the companion acts normally on their turn. On a failure, or if the caregiver doesn't make the check, the companion enters a rampage.

When a companion enters a rampage, they immediately move up to their speed toward the nearest creature they can sense and attack that creature with their signature attack (see below), dealing extra damage equal to half their ferocity if the attack hits. If at least one ally and one enemy are nearest and equidistant to the companion, the caregiver's player rolls any die. On an odd number, the companion attacks an ally. On an even number, the companion attacks an enemy. The caregiver's player determines which specific equidistant ally or enemy the companion engages (and can choose their own character if they wish).

A companion who can't reach a creature to attack while in a rampage uses the Dash action to move as far as they can toward the nearest creature they can sense. If a companion can't sense any potential targets, they move as far as they can in a random direction determined by the GM, avoiding danger.

When a companion who has entered a rampage resolves their action or ends their turn, their ferocity drops to 0 and they're no longer in a rampage

Reducing Ferocity

To prevent a companion from entering a dangerous rampage, a caregiver has several options at their disposal for reducing the creature's ferocity.

Ferocity Actions. Each companion has three actions in their stat block that cost ferocity to use. To use one of these ferocity actions, the caregiver's character level must be equal to or greater than the ferocity action's level, and the companion must spend the necessary amount of ferocity before they use the action. If the companion doesn't have enough ferocity to spend, they can't use the action.

Ferocity actions always use the companion's action, meaning they can't be used as part of an opportunity attack. Ferocity actions can't be used while a companion is in a rampage.

End of Combat. When a combat encounter involving a companion ends and the companion isn't dying, the companion regains hit points equal to their ferocity, and their ferocity drops to 0. The GM determines when a combat encounter ends, typically at the point when creatures stop acting in initiative order.

Stone Gaze.name: Stone Gaze
Stone Gaze.description:
Emer fires beams of energy from her eyes at up to three creatures she can see within 60 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or begin turning to stone (save ends at end of turn). While turning to stone, a creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet and they have disadvantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

If a creature who is turning to stone is targeted by this action again and fails their save, their speed is reduced by another 10 feet and they are &Reference[dazed apply=false] until the effect ends.

If a creature who is turning to stone and dazed in this way is targeted by this action again and fails their save, they are &Reference[petrified] and can no longer make saving throws to end the effects of Stone Gaze. The petrification lasts until the creature is restored by Emer's Stone Sacrifice trait, a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher, a greater restoration spell, or a similar supernatural effect.

The second builds on top of the first, meaning any target at the second stage of petrification should have two effects. Once a creature reaches full petrification, simply use the regular Petrified condition.

Stone Gaze.name: Stone Gaze
Stone Gaze.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] fires energy beams from their eyes at up to three creatures they can see within 60 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or begin turning to stone (save ends at end of turn). While turning to stone, a creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet and they have disadvantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

If a creature who is turning to stone is targeted by this action again and fails their save, their speed is reduced by another 10 feet and they are &Reference[dazed apply=false] until the effect ends.

If a creature who is turning to stone and dazed in this way is targeted by this action again and fails their save, they are &Reference[petrified] and can no longer make saving throws to end the effects of Stone Gaze. The petrification lasts until the creature is restored by a cure ailment power of 4th order or higher, a greater restoration spell, or a similar supernatural effect.

Foundry Note

This item contains two effects that can be applied to keep track of the stage of petrification. The second builds on top of the first, meaning any target at the second stage of petrification should have two effects. Once a creature reaches full petrification, simply use the regular Petrified condition.

Turning to Stone (Stage I).name: Turning to Stone (Stage I)
Turning to Stone (Stage I).description: While turning to stone, a creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet and they have disadvantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws.

Turning to Stone (Stage II).name: Turning to Stone (Stage II)

Panic Shift.name: Panic Shift
Panic Shift.description: The monster's walking and climbing speed are doubled, and they have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

Envelop.name: Envelop
Envelop.description:
While grappling a creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses their Shapechanger action to polymorph into an object that is the same size or bigger than the grappled creature (if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] isn't already in such a form).

The creature is then enveloped by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. An enveloped creature is no longer grappled, but they can't breathe, are &reference[blinded] and &reference[restrained], have &reference[totalcover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and take [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves, the enveloped creature moves with them. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can envelop one creature at a time.

An enveloped creature can use their action to try to escape by making a [[/check str 13]] check. On a successful check, the creature is no longer enveloped and is shunted to an unoccupied space of their choice within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. The creature automatically escapes if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Shapechanger or Panic Shift, becomes &reference[incapacitated apply=false], or dies.

affects.special: A creature the monster is grappling.

Enveloped.name: Enveloped
Enveloped.description:
You are enveloped by the monster. You cannot breathe, you are &reference[blinded apply=false], &reference[restrained apply=false], and have &reference[totalcover apply=false] against attack and other effects outside the monster. You take [[/damage 3d6 acid average]] damage at the start of each of the monster's turns.

Whenever the monster moves, you move with them. You can use your action to try to escape by making a [[/check 13 str]] check. On a successful check, the you are no longer enveloped by the monster and are shunted to an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of the monster.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has a flying speed of [[lookup @prof.flat]]0 feet.

Death Chant.description: When an enemy succeeds on a death saving throw while within 30 feet of three or more [[lookup @name lowercase]] who aren't incapacitated, the success instead counts as a failure, and if the roll was a 20, the enemy doesn't regain hit points.

Soul Devourer.name: Soul Devourer
Soul Devourer.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] reduces a creature who isn't a Construct or an Undead to 0 hit points or deals damage to a dying creature, the creature must make a [[/save]] saving throw. On a failed save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] consumes the creature's soul and adds 1 to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s soul count. A creature whose soul is consumed in this way immediately dies, and they can't be restored to life by any means short of a wish spell.

Lethe.name: Lethe
Lethe.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s soul count is 0, they have advantage on attack rolls, disadvantage on saving throws, and their Intelligence score becomes 3 (4). Additionally, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must use their movement on each of their turns to move as close as possible to the nearest creature they can sense with their soulsight, and then if they are able, they must use their action to attack and attempt to kill that creature. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't act with any other purpose until they add 1 to their soul count.

Cannot act with any other purpose until they add 1 to their soul count.

Each creature must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or be &reference[charmed] for 1 minute or until they deal damage to another creature. While charmed, the creature sees all allies as enemies and all enemies as allies.

Tiny Time.name: Tiny Time
Tiny Time.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically shrinks down to a height of 1inch, becoming Tiny along with any items they wear or carry. While Tiny, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and they can use a bonus action to enter the head of an unconscious Humanoid they can reach or to grow back to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s normal size. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s game statistics otherwise remain the same.

While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is inside a Humanoid's head, that Humanoid is considered haunted by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the head. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can speak telepathically to the haunted Humanoid, but the Humanoid is unaware of the source of this telepathic speech. The haunted Humanoid can't gain any benefit from rest unless the [[lookup @name lowercase]] allows it, and when the Humanoid attempts to sleep, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can fill the Humanoid's mind with nightmarish visions.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is expelled from the head and grows back to their normal size if the haunted Humanoid is affected by a dispel evil and good spell or similar supernatural effects, or if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses to exit the head as a bonus action.

Tiny.name: Tiny
Tiny.description: You are Tiny and have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

Sleepwalk.name: Sleepwalk
Sleepwalk.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves one unconscious creature they can see within 60 feet of them up to 30 feet horizontally.

Aren't You Tired?.name: Aren't You Tired?
Aren't You Tired?.description: When a creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits them with an attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] spits sleep dust at the attacker. The attacker must make a [[/save]] saving throw. On a failed save, until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn, the attacker feels tremendously sleepy, they can't take reactions, and they have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. Creatures who can't be supernaturally put to sleep are immune to this effect.

save.condition: When a creature within range hits the monster with an attack.

Aren't You Tired?.name: Aren't You Tired?
Aren't You Tired?.description: You feel sleepy, cannot take reactions, and you have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

At will: alter self, detect magic, pass without trace

3/day each: dream, legend lore, mirage arcane

Primordial Influence.name: Primordial Influence
Primordial Influence.description:
A dazed enemy who starts their turn within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make a [[/save]] saving throw. On a failed save, that creature's body is altered in an otherworldly way of the GM's choicethey might flicker in and out of reality, sprout miniature fingers from their fingers, or have their physical form altered in a similarly alien way. This alteration doesn't affect the creature's game statistics. A cure ailment power of 4th order or higher, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{Greater Restoration} spell, or a similar supernatural effect reverses this alteration.

While altered in this way, a creature must repeat the saving throw whenever they finish a long rest. On a failed save, their previous alteration worsens or they experience another chaotic alteration of the GM's choice. If a creature fails this saving throw three times after their initial alteration, they transform into a [[lookup @name lowercase]] controlled by the GM, and only a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{Wish} spell can restore the creature to their original form.

Not What I Seem.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] begins combat disguised as an inexperienced warrior. They have advantage on their first weapon attack roll against a creature who hasn't seen them make an attack.

Shield? Shield!.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a +1 bonus to AC while within 5 feet of at least one ally who also has this trait, is wielding a shield, and isn't incapacitated or prone. To benefit from this trait, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must be wielding a shield.

On an odd result, the net burns away and is destroyed, freeing the restrained creature. A creature who attempts to free the restrained creature from the net (as described in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Net attack) automatically puts out the fire as part of that action, regardless of whether that check succeeds.

The Wilderkith have five villain party actions. The party can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. The party can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round. An action can be taken only if the creature performing it is present in the encounter and isn't &reference[incapacitated apply=false].

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Shield? Shield!.name: Shield? Shield!
Shield? Shield!.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a +1 bonus to AC while within 5 feet of at least one ally who also has this trait, is wielding a shield, and isn't incapacitated or prone. To benefit from this trait, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must be wielding a shield.

Shield? Shield!.name: Shield? Shield!
Shield? Shield!.description: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a shield and within 5 feet of at least one ally who also has the Shield? Shield! trait, is wielding a shield, and is not incapacitated or prone.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item eT6TqgqXXv866Y56]] attacks. They can replace one attack with a [[/item cmnoOM5LglAECsHD]] attack.

Shield Bash.name: Shield Bash
Shield Bash.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they must succeed on a [[/save]] saving throw or be knocked &reference[prone].

Reinforce.name: Reinforce
Reinforce.description: When an ally within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is targeted by an attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of that creature. If that creature also has the Shield? Shield! trait, they gain the benefit of that trait against the triggering attack. To use this reaction, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must be able to see the ally and the attacker.

utility.condition: When an ally within 10 feet is targeted by an attack.

Water Wing.name: Water Wing
Water Wing.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the same creature is hit twice with this attack on a turn, they are vulnerable to lightning damage until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turn.

Water Wing: Vulnerability.name: Water Wing: Vulnerability
Water Wing: Vulnerability.description: You are vulnerable to lightning damage until the end of the monster's turn.

Water Glide.name: Water Glide
Water Glide.description:
While within 5 feet of a liquid or solid surface, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains a flying speed equal to their swimming speed. While flying, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

Foundry Note

You can toggle the effect on this item at will to grant or remove the flying speed.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item 2d1nNDBwECpyPedl]] attacks and one [[/item kw9PcghrWd5LB8pH]] attack.

Convocation of Water.name: Convocation of Water
Convocation of Water.description:
The essence imbues the power of water in themself or another Elemental they can see within 30 feet, granting one of the following effects of that Elemental's choice:

  • Scalding Steam. The Elemental spouts blistering steam. Each non-Elemental creature within 15 feet of them must make a [[/save]] saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes [[/damage average]] damage and is &reference[blinded] until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

  • Waters of Vitality. The Elemental regains 25 hit points and can end one of the following conditions affecting them: &reference[blinded apply=false], &reference[charmed apply=false], &reference[dazed apply=false], &reference[deafened apply=false], &reference[paralyzed apply=false], &reference[poisoned apply=false], or &reference[stunned apply=false].

Exploit Opening.name: Exploit Opening
Exploit Opening.description: When [[lookup @name]] makes an attack, she has advantage on the attack roll.

Sure-Footed.name: Sure-Footed
Sure-Footed.description: [[lookup @name]] has advantage on saving throws against being moved against her will or knocked &reference[prone apply=false].

Tactical Vigilance.name: Tactical Vigilance
Tactical Vigilance.description: [[lookup @name]] has advantage on initiative checks. While she isn't &reference[incapacitated apply=false], [[lookup @name]] and each ally within 30 feet of her who can see or hear her can't be surprised.

Protector.name: Protector
Protector.description: When a creature [[lookup @name]] can see within 10 feet of her attacks one of her allies, [[lookup @name]] can make a [[/item m4q8M6pjzuhrQECN]] attack against the attacker.

utility.condition: When a creature within 10 feet of the monster attacks one of their allies.

Strategic Positioning.name: Strategic Positioning
Strategic Positioning.description: [[lookup @name]] and each ally within 60 feet of her who can see or hear her can move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks and take the &reference[Hide] action.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Hungry Charge.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half their speed in a straight line. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves at least 15 feet and ends this movement within 5 feet of a creature, they have advantage on the next attack roll they make against that creature until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.
